item.title: Adding a new Staff rank Example : Server Helper
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

AtomicInt_:

way over done for something as simple as this imo.

It’s way better, that’s what I do. Makes it way easier to add ranks, why add a new token for every rank you’d like to have on the server?

item.title: Adding a new Staff rank Example : Server Helper
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:9, topic:508148”][quote author=Scape-JAVA link=topic=626386.msg4261030#msg4261030 date=1363463280]
This is pretty poor, but good job on your first attempt ;p. What I would of done is just use an array and I would of got the appropriate title be displayed according to the players rank.

String[] title = { "player", "mod", "admin" }; etc.

Also, instead of those ugly if/else statements you could of used switch conditionals.

String title = "";
switch(c.playerRights) {

	case 1:
                title = "moderator ";
        break;
	case 2:
		title = "admin";
         break;
}

Something like that.
[/quote]

As for the switch – I would do something like this:

[code=java]
private final String getNameForPrivilege(int privilege) {
switch (privilege) {
case 0:
return “Player”;
case 1:
return “Moderator”;
case 2:
return “Administrator”;
default:
return “Player”;
}
}

private final void yellFunction() {
String[] context = cmd.split(" ");
/* ... legacy code ... */
sendWorldMessage("[" + getNameForPrivilege(player.getPrivilege()) + "]: " + context[0].substring(cmd.length() + 1));
}

[/code][/quote]
I like that too
Well like i said it’s my first time i posted a snippet :o
Thx For replys

Read full topic
item.source: Adding a new Staff rank Example : Server Helper

item.title: Adding a new Staff rank Example : Server Helper
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“Scape-JAVA, post:8, topic:508148”]This is pretty poor, but good job on your first attempt ;p. What I would of done is just use an array and I would of got the appropriate title be displayed according to the players rank.

String[] title = { "player", "mod", "admin" }; etc.

Also, instead of those ugly if/else statements you could of used switch conditionals.

String title = "";
switch(c.playerRights) {

	case 1:
                title = "moderator ";
        break;
	case 2:
		title = "admin";
         break;
}

Something like that.[/quote]

As for the switch – I would do something like this:

    private final String getNameForPrivilege(int privilege) {
	switch (privilege) {
	case 0:
	    return "Player";
	case 1:
	    return "Moderator";
	case 2:
	    return "Administrator";
	default:
	    return "Player";
	}
    }

    private final void yellFunction() {
	String[] context = cmd.split(" ");
	/* ... legacy code ... */
	sendWorldMessage("[" + getNameForPrivilege(player.getPrivilege()) + "]: " + context[0].substring(cmd.length() + 1));
    }

Read full topic
